Findings: Three temporary contractor accounts (TEMP_JONES, TEMP_SMITH, TEMP_DAVIS) have no expiration date set. AD review confirmed accounts active for 45+ days without review.
Seven standard user accounts have local Administrator group membership. No business justification on file for elevated access.
Audit policy for User Account Management and Logon/Logoff events not configured. auditpol confirms No Auditing for these subcategories.
System is not forwarding logs to centralized SIEM. Splunk Universal Forwarder not installed.
POA&M items older than 90 days have not been updated. 4 items past due with no milestone updates.
Multiple STIG settings not applied: PowerShell 2.0 not removed, AlwaysInstallElevated registry key set to 1, password complexity disabled.
Telnet Client feature installed. Legacy FTP service running. Both prohibited by system baseline.
Password complexity policy disabled in local security policy. Minimum length requirement not enforced via GPO. Two service accounts found with passwords older than 365 days.
Last vulnerability scan completed 47 days ago. Policy requires monthly scanning. Apache Log4j 2.14.1 detected â€” known vulnerable version (Log4Shell CVE-2021-44228).
TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 still enabled on IIS. Only TLS 1.2+ should be permitted. SCAP scan confirmed deprecated protocol support.
BitLocker not enabled on data volumes of NIPRNET-DB-01. Sensitive database files not encrypted at rest.
22 outstanding security patches older than 30 days. 3 critical patches (CVSS >= 9.0) older than 15 days. Windows Update configured to manual.
Windows Defender disabled on NIPRNET-WEB-01 and NIPRNET-DB-01. No alternative AV solution detected.
